text: The system shall observe signals in the X-band(10 GHz).
The system shall use a receiver for astronomical observation.
The system shall be able to observe objects located at up to 80 degrees elevation.
The system shall be equipped with a modern control system.
The system shall deploy an air lock on cabin door if left open.
The system shall be able to point to a specified point in the sky.
The system shall safely observe by cooling 1 and 3 mm receivers.
The system shall accept a stream of manual or automated pointing commands.
The system shall observe in the 1 mm and 3 mm range.
The system shall avoid dangerous loads.
The system shall have a stowable antenna for power outage occurrence.
The system shall have the capability to lock all moving parts during maintenance or emergency.
The system shall collect information on the antenna's position even when it is not pointing to a degree of accuracy within 1 arcsec.
The system shall be able to track at 0.1 degrees per second, elevation angular speed 0.1 degrees/second.
